newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso ends firm on capital inflow.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso ends firm on capital inflow.

text.p: The Mexican peso closed stronger across the board on Wednesday following the Federal Open Market Committee's decision to leave U.S. interest rates unchnaged, traders said.
"Foreigners stepped in (to Mexican markets) due to the FOMC, the market is optimistic and the peso is very strong," a trader said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour stablemate both closed 1.9 centavos firmer, respectively, at 7.8590/7.8610 and 7.8560/7.8590 per dollar.
Same-day peso contracts had earlier closed 1.6 centavos firmer at 7.8620/7.8670 per dollar.
